data.meta_description: This is your hub for all of the Mercedes-Benz sales data for the U.S market. Historical Mercedes-Benz car sales data as well as monthly updates of the latest sales data.
data.text:
The Current Mercedes-Benz Model Lineup & Prices in the U.S

Mercedes-Benz refreshed and introduced several models during this period. Notable introductions include the redesigned S-Class, a benchmark in luxury sedans, and the A-Class, which targets younger demographics and those entering the luxury car segment. Mercedes-Benz has one of the broadest current model lineups in the U.S market. We are sharing a summary below, but there are many more combinations and sub-variants.

Mercedes-Benz EQB SUV

Starting at $52,750

The Mercedes-Benz EQB is a compact electric SUV that was first introduced in 2022. It is based on the Mercedes-Benz GLB SUV, but has a number of changes to accommodate its electric powertrain. The EQB is available in two models: the EQB 250+ and the EQB 350 4MATIC. The EQB 250+ has a single electric motor on the front axle that produces 188 horsepower and 277 lb-ft of torque. The EQB 350 4MATIC has two electric motors, one on each axle, that produce a combined 288 horsepower and 384 lb-ft of torque. Both models have a 70.5 kWh battery pack that provides an EPA-estimated range of 221 miles for the EQB 250+ and 245 miles for the EQB 350 4MATIC. The EQB can be charged using a standard household outlet, a Level 2 charger, or a DC fast charger. The EQB has a spacious interior that can seat up to seven passengers. The second row of seats can be folded flat to increase cargo space. The EQB also comes standard with a number of features, including a 10.25-inch digital instrument cluster, a 10.25-inch touchscreen infotainment system, and a panoramic sunroof.

Mercedes-Benz EQE Sedan

Starting at $74,900

The Mercedes-Benz EQE sedan is a luxury electric sedan that was first introduced in 2023. It is based on the Mercedes-Benz E-Class sedan, but has a number of changes to accommodate its electric powertrain. The EQE is available in two models: the EQE 350+ and the EQE 500 4MATIC. The EQE 350+ has a single electric motor on the rear axle that produces 288 horsepower and 391 lb-ft of torque. The EQE 500 4MATIC has two electric motors, one on each axle, that produce a combined 402 horsepower and 516 lb-ft of torque.

Both models have a 90.6 kWh battery pack that provides an EPA-estimated range of 305 miles for the EQE 350+ and 260 miles for the EQE 500 4MATIC. The EQE can be charged using a standard household outlet, a Level 2 charger, or a DC fast charger. The EQE has a luxurious interior that is similar to the E-Class sedan. It features high-quality materials, comfortable seats, and a spacious cabin. The EQE also comes standard with a number of features, including a 12.3-inch digital instrument cluster, a 12.8-inch touchscreen infotainment system, and a Burmester sound system. The Mercedes-Benz EQE sedan starts at $74,900 for the EQE 350+ and $85,900 for the EQE 500 4MATIC.

Mercedes-Benz EQE SUV

Starting at $77,900

The Mercedes-Benz EQE SUV is a luxury electric SUV that was first introduced in 2023. It is based on the Mercedes-Benz EQE sedan, but has a number of changes to accommodate its SUV body style. The EQE SUV is available in two models: the EQE 350+ and the EQE 500 4MATIC. The EQE 350+ has a single electric motor on the rear axle that produces 288 horsepower and 391 lb-ft of torque. The EQE 500 4MATIC has two electric motors, one on each axle, that produce a combined 402 horsepower and 516 lb-ft of torque.

Both models have a 90.6 kWh battery pack that provides an EPA-estimated range of 279 miles for the EQE 350+ and 269 miles for the EQE 500 4MATIC. The EQE SUV can be charged using a standard household outlet, a Level 2 charger, or a DC fast charger. The EQE SUV has a luxurious interior that is similar to the EQE sedan. It features high-quality materials, comfortable seats, and a spacious cabin. The EQE SUV also comes standard with a number of features, including a 12.3-inch digital instrument cluster, a 12.8-inch touchscreen infotainment system, and a Burmester sound system.

The Mercedes-Benz EQE SUV starts at $77,900 for the EQE 350+ and $89,500 for the EQE 500 4MATIC.

Mercedes-Benz EQS Sedan

Starting at $104,400

The Mercedes-Benz EQS sedan is a luxury electric sedan that was first introduced in 2022. It is the first model in the all-electric EQS range from Mercedes-Benz. The EQS is available in three models: the EQS 450+, the EQS 500 4MATIC, and the AMG EQS 53 4MATIC+. The EQS 450+ has a single electric motor on the rear axle that produces 329 horsepower and 406 lb-ft of torque. The EQS 500 4MATIC has two electric motors, one on each axle, that produce a combined 429 horsepower and 561 lb-ft of torque. The AMG EQS 53 4MATIC+ has two electric motors that produce a combined 649 horsepower and 700 lb-ft of torque.

All models have a 108.7 kWh battery pack that provides an EPA-estimated range of 350 miles for the EQS 450+, 340 miles for the EQS 500 4MATIC, and 320 miles for the AMG EQS 53 4MATIC+. The EQS can be charged using a standard household outlet, a Level 2 charger, or a DC fast charger. The EQS has a luxurious interior that is similar to the S-Class sedan. It features high-quality materials, comfortable seats, and a spacious cabin. The EQS also comes standard with a number of features, including a 12.3-inch digital instrument cluster, a 12.8-inch touchscreen infotainment system, and a Burmester sound system.

The Mercedes-Benz EQS sedan starts at $104,400 for the EQS 450+, $107,400 for the EQS 500 4MATIC, and $125,950 for the AMG EQS 53 4MATIC+.

Mercedes-Benz EQS SUV

Starting at $104,400

The Mercedes-Benz EQS SUV is a luxury electric SUV that was first introduced in 2023. It is based on the Mercedes-Benz EQS sedan, but has a number of changes to accommodate its SUV body style. The EQS SUV is available in two models: the EQS 450+ and the EQS 580 4MATIC. The EQS 450+ has a single electric motor on the rear axle that produces 355 horsepower and 419 lb-ft of torque. The EQS 580 4MATIC has two electric motors, one on each axle, that produce a combined 536 horsepower and 701 lb-ft of torque.

Both models have a 108.7 kWh battery pack that provides an EPA-estimated range of 305 miles for the EQS 450+ and 285 miles for the EQS 580 4MATIC. The EQS SUV can be charged using a standard household outlet, a Level 2 charger, or a DC fast charger. The EQS SUV has a luxurious interior that is similar to the EQS sedan. It features high-quality materials, comfortable seats, and a spacious cabin. The EQS SUV also comes standard with a number of features, including a 12.3-inch digital instrument cluster, a 12.8-inch touchscreen infotainment system, and a Burmester sound system. The EQS SUV also has a third row of seats, which is optional on the EQS sedan.

The Mercedes-Benz EQS SUV starts at $104,400 for the EQS 450+ and $125,950 for the EQS 580 4MATIC.

Mercedes-Benz GLA SUV

Starting at $37,500

The Mercedes-Benz GLA is a compact luxury SUV that was first introduced in 2014. It is the smallest SUV in the Mercedes-Benz lineup. The GLA is available in two models: the GLA 250 and the GLA 250 4MATIC. The GLA 250 has a turbocharged 2.0-liter four-cylinder engine that produces 221 horsepower and 258 lb-ft of torque. The GLA 250 4MATIC has all-wheel drive.

Both models come standard with a 7-speed dual-clutch automatic transmission. The GLA gets an EPA-estimated 24 mpg in the city and 34 mpg on the highway. The GLA has a spacious interior for its class and can seat up to five passengers. The cargo space is 15.4 cubic feet, which is a bit small for a compact SUV. The GLA comes standard with a number of features, including a 7-inch digital instrument cluster, a 7-inch touchscreen infotainment system, and a rearview camera. Available features include a panoramic sunroof, a Burmester sound system, and a head-up display.

Mercedes-Benz GLB SUV

Starting at $39,800

The Mercedes-Benz GLB is a compact luxury SUV that was first introduced in 2019. It is larger than the GLA SUV and can seat up to seven passengers. The GLB is available in three models: the GLB 250, the GLB 250 4MATIC, and the AMG GLB 35. The GLB 250 has a turbocharged 2.0-liter four-cylinder engine that produces 221 horsepower and 258 lb-ft of torque. The GLB 250 4MATIC has all-wheel drive. The AMG GLB 35 has a turbocharged 2.0-liter four-cylinder engine that produces 302 horsepower and 295 lb-ft of torque.

All models come standard with a 7-speed dual-clutch automatic transmission. The GLB gets an EPA-estimated 24 mpg in the city and 31 mpg on the highway. The GLB has a spacious interior for its class and can seat up to seven passengers. The cargo space is 23.7 cubic feet, which is more than the GLA SUV. The GLB comes standard with a number of features, including a 7-inch digital instrument cluster, a 7-inch touchscreen infotainment system, and a rearview camera. Available features include a panoramic sunroof, a Burmester sound system, and a head-up display.

The Mercedes-Benz GLB starts at $39,800 for the GLB 250, $41,800 for the GLB 250 4MATIC, and $46,700 for the AMG GLB 35.

Mercedes-Benz GLC SUV / Coupe

Starting at $42,350 / Coupe Starting at $44,850

The Mercedes-Benz GLC is a mid-size luxury SUV that was first introduced in 2015. It is available in two body styles: the SUV and the Coupe. The GLC SUV is available in three models: the GLC 300, the GLC 300 4MATIC, and the AMG GLC 43. The GLC 300 has a turbocharged 2.0-liter four-cylinder engine that produces 255 horsepower and 273 lb-ft of torque. The GLC 300 4MATIC has all-wheel drive. The AMG GLC 43 has a turbocharged 3.0-liter V6 engine that produces 385 horsepower and 384 lb-ft of torque.

The GLC Coupe is available in two models: the GLC 300 Coupe and the AMG GLC 43 Coupe. The GLC 300 Coupe has the same engine as the GLC 300 SUV. The AMG GLC 43 Coupe has the same engine as the AMG GLC 43 SUV. All models come standard with a 9-speed automatic transmission. The GLC gets an EPA-estimated 23 mpg in the city and 32 mpg on the highway for the SUV and 22 mpg in the city and 29 mpg on the highway for the Coupe. The GLC SUV has a spacious interior for its class and can seat up to five passengers. The cargo space is 26.9 cubic feet, which is more than some rivals.

The GLC Coupe has a smaller interior than the SUV, but it still has enough space for four adults. The cargo space is 17.6 cubic feet, which is less than the SUV. The GLC SUV comes standard with a number of features, including a 7-inch digital instrument cluster, a 10.25-inch touchscreen infotainment system, and a rearview camera. Available features include a panoramic sunroof, a Burmester sound system, and a head-up display. The GLC Coupe comes standard with the same features as the SUV, but it also has a sport-tuned suspension and steering.

The Mercedes-Benz GLC SUV starts at $42,350 for the GLC 300, $44,350 for the GLC 300 4MATIC, and $54,250 for the AMG GLC 43. The GLC Coupe starts at $44,850 for the GLC 300 Coupe and $56,750 for the AMG GLC 43 Coupe.

Mercedes-Benz GLE SUV / Coupe

Starting at $54,950 / Coupe Starting at $61,500

The Mercedes-Benz GLE is a mid-size luxury SUV that was first introduced in 2015. It is available in two body styles: the SUV and the Coupe. The GLE SUV is available in four models: the GLE 350, the GLE 350 4MATIC, the AMG GLE 43, and the AMG GLE 53. The GLE 350 has a turbocharged 2.0-liter four-cylinder engine that produces 255 horsepower and 273 lb-ft of torque. The GLE 350 4MATIC has all-wheel drive. The AMG GLE 43 has a turbocharged 3.0-liter V6 engine that produces 385 horsepower and 384 lb-ft of torque. The AMG GLE 53 has a turbocharged 3.0-liter inline-6 engine that produces 429 horsepower and 384 lb-ft of torque.

The GLE Coupe is available in three models: the GLE 450 Coupe, the AMG GLE 53 Coupe, and the AMG GLE 63 S Coupe. The GLE 450 Coupe has the same engine as the GLE 350 Coupe. The AMG GLE 53 Coupe has the same engine as the AMG GLE 53 SUV. The AMG GLE 63 S Coupe has a twin-turbocharged 4.0-liter V8 engine that produces 603 horsepower and 627 lb-ft of torque. All models come standard with a 9-speed automatic transmission. The GLE gets an EPA-estimated 22 mpg in the city and 29 mpg on the highway for the SUV and 21 mpg in the city and 27 mpg on the highway for the Coupe. The GLE SUV has a spacious interior for its class and can seat up to five passengers. The cargo space is 29.5 cubic feet, which is more than some rivals.

The GLE Coupe has a smaller interior than the SUV, but it still has enough space for four adults. The cargo space is 17.2 cubic feet, which is less than the SUV. The GLE SUV comes standard with a number of features, including a 12.3-inch digital instrument cluster, a 12.3-inch touchscreen infotainment system, and a rearview camera. Available features include a panoramic sunroof, a Burmester sound system, and a head-up display. The GLE Coupe comes standard with the same features as the SUV, but it also has a sport-tuned suspension and steering.

The Mercedes-Benz GLE SUV starts at $54,950 for the GLE 350, $57,350 for the GLE 350 4MATIC, $68,650 for the AMG GLE 43, and $77,650 for the AMG GLE 53. The GLE Coupe starts at $61,500 for the GLE 450 Coupe, $73,900 for the AMG GLE 53 Coupe, and $113,400 for the AMG GLE 63 S Coupe.

Mercedes-Benz GLS SUV

Starting at $76,000

The Mercedes-Benz GLS is a full-size luxury SUV that was first introduced in 2016. It is the largest SUV in the Mercedes-Benz lineup. The GLS is available in three models: the GLS 450, the GLS 450 4MATIC, and the AMG GLS 63. The GLS 450 has a turbocharged 3.0-liter inline-6 engine that produces 362 horsepower and 369 lb-ft of torque. The GLS 450 4MATIC has all-wheel drive. The AMG GLS 63 has a twin-turbocharged 4.0-liter V8 engine that produces 603 horsepower and 627 lb-ft of torque.

All models come standard with a 9-speed automatic transmission. The GLS gets an EPA-estimated 19 mpg in the city and 26 mpg on the highway for the GLS 450, 19 mpg in the city and 25 mpg on the highway for the GLS 450 4MATIC, and 17 mpg in the city and 22 mpg on the highway for the AMG GLS 63. The GLS has a spacious interior for its class and can seat up to seven passengers. The cargo space is 18.1 cubic feet, which is less than some rivals. The GLS comes standard with a number of features, including a 12.3-inch digital instrument cluster, a 12.3-inch touchscreen infotainment system, and a rearview camera. Available features include a panoramic sunroof, a Burmester sound system, and a head-up display.

The Mercedes-Benz GLS starts at $76,000 for the GLS 450, $78,300 for the GLS 450 4MATIC, and $111,950 for the AMG GLS 63.

Mercedes-Benz G-Class SUV

Starting at $106,450

The Mercedes-Benz G-Class SUV is a luxury SUV that is known for its rugged off-road capabilities and boxy design. It was first introduced in 1979 and is still in production today. The G-Class is available in two models: the G 550 and the AMG G 63. The G 550 has a 4.0-liter V8 engine that produces 416 horsepower and 450 lb-ft of torque. The AMG G 63 has a 4.0-liter V8 engine that produces 577 horsepower and 627 lb-ft of torque.

All models come standard with a 9-speed automatic transmission and four-wheel drive. The G-Class gets an EPA-estimated 13 mpg in the city and 17 mpg on the highway for the G 550, and 13 mpg in the city and 16 mpg on the highway for the AMG G 63. The G-Class has a spacious interior for its class and can seat up to five passengers. The cargo space is 68.9 cubic feet, which is more than some rivals. The G-Class comes standard with a number of features, including a 12.3-inch digital instrument cluster, a 12.3-inch touchscreen infotainment system, and a Burmester sound system. Available features include a panoramic sunroof, a head-up display, and a night-vision system.

The Mercedes-Benz G-Class starts at $106,450 for the G 550 and $131,850 for the AMG G 63.

Mercedes-Maybach GLS SUV

Starting at $161,500

The Mercedes-Maybach GLS SUV is a luxury SUV that is based on the Mercedes-Benz GLS SUV. It was first introduced in 2019 and is the most luxurious SUV in the Mercedes-Benz lineup. The Mercedes-Maybach GLS SUV is powered by a 4.0-liter twin-turbocharged V8 engine that produces 496 horsepower and 516 lb-ft of torque. It is paired with a 9-speed automatic transmission and all-wheel drive. The Mercedes-Maybach GLS SUV gets an EPA-estimated 14 mpg in the city and 19 mpg on the highway.

The Mercedes-Maybach GLS SUV has a spacious interior for its class and can seat up to four passengers. The rear seats are separated by a console and have a number of features, including reclining seats, massage functions, and a refrigerator. The cargo space is 18.9 cubic feet, which is less than some rivals. The Mercedes-Maybach GLS SUV comes standard with a number of features, including a 12.3-inch digital instrument cluster, a 12.3-inch touchscreen infotainment system, a Burmester sound system, and a panoramic sunroof. Available features include a head-up display, a night-vision system, and a rear-seat entertainment system.

The Mercedes-Maybach GLS SUV starts at $161,500.

Mercedes-Benz A-Class Sedan

Starting at $33,950

The Mercedes-Benz A-Class Sedan is a compact luxury sedan that was first introduced in 2018. It is the smallest sedan in the Mercedes-Benz lineup. The A-Class Sedan is available in two models: the A 220 and the AMG A 35. The A 220 has a turbocharged 2.0-liter four-cylinder engine that produces 188 horsepower and 221 lb-ft of torque. The AMG A 35 has the same engine, but it is tuned to produce 302 horsepower and 295 lb-ft of torque.

All models come standard with a 7-speed dual-clutch automatic transmission. The A-Class Sedan gets an EPA-estimated 25 mpg in the city and 35 mpg on the highway for the A 220, and 24 mpg in the city and 31 mpg on the highway for the AMG A 35. The A-Class Sedan has a spacious interior for its class and can seat up to five passengers. The cargo space is 19.9 cubic feet, which is more than some rivals. The A-Class Sedan comes standard with a number of features, including a 7-inch digital instrument cluster, a 7-inch touchscreen infotainment system, and a rearview camera. Available features include a panoramic sunroof, a Burmester sound system, and a head-up display.

The Mercedes-Benz A-Class Sedan starts at $33,950 for the A 220 and $41,450 for the AMG A 35.

Mercedes-Benz C-Class Sedan / Coupe / Cabriolet

Starting at $44,850 / Coupe Starting at $49,550 / Cabriolet Starting at $57,250

The Mercedes-Benz C-Class is a compact luxury car that has been around since 1993. It is available in three body styles: sedan, coupe, and convertible. The C-Class Sedan is the most popular body style and is available in two models: the C 300 and the AMG C 43. The C 300 has a turbocharged 2.0-liter four-cylinder engine that produces 255 horsepower and 273 lb-ft of torque. The AMG C 43 has a turbocharged 3.0-liter V6 engine that produces 385 horsepower and 384 lb-ft of torque. The C-Class Coupe and Cabriolet are available in two models: the C 300 and the AMG C 43. The C 300 has the same engine as the C 300 Sedan. The AMG C 43 has the same engine as the AMG C 43 Sedan.

Mercedes-Benz E-Class Sedan / Coupe / Cabriolet / Wagon

Starting at $56,750 / Coupe Starting at $69,750 / Cabriolet Starting at $76,900 / Wagon Starting at $71,250

The Mercedes-Benz E-Class is a mid-size luxury car that has been around since 1993. It is available in four body styles: sedan, coupe, convertible, and wagon. The E-Class Sedan is the most popular body style and is available in three models: the E 350, the E 450, and the AMG E 53. The E 350 has a turbocharged 2.0-liter four-cylinder engine that produces 255 horsepower and 273 lb-ft of torque. The E 450 has a turbocharged 3.0-liter inline-6 engine that produces 362 horsepower and 369 lb-ft of torque. The AMG E 53 has a turbocharged 3.0-liter inline-6 engine that produces 429 horsepower and 384 lb-ft of torque.

The E-Class Coupe and Cabriolet are available in two models: the E 450 and the AMG E 53. The E 450 has the same engine as the E 450 Sedan. The AMG E 53 has the same engine as the AMG E 53 Sedan. The E-Class Wagon is available in two models: the E 350 and the AMG E 450. The E 350 has the same engine as the E 350 Sedan. The AMG E 450 has the same engine as the AMG E 450 Sedan.

Mercedes-Benz S-Class Sedan

Starting at $114,500

The Mercedes-Benz S-Class is a full-size luxury sedan that has been around since 1972. It is the flagship sedan of Mercedes-Benz and is known for its luxurious interior, advanced technology, and powerful engines. The S-Class is available in three models: the S 500, the S 580, and the AMG S 63. The S 500 has a turbocharged 3.0-liter inline-6 engine that produces 429 horsepower and 384 lb-ft of torque. The S 580 has a turbocharged 4.0-liter V8 engine that produces 496 horsepower and 516 lb-ft of torque. The AMG S 63 has a twin-turbocharged 4.0-liter V8 engine that produces 603 horsepower and 627 lb-ft of torque.

Mercedes-Benz Maybach S-Class

Starting at $193,400

The Mercedes-Benz Maybach S-Class is a luxury sedan that is based on the Mercedes-Benz S-Class. It was first introduced in 2015 and is the most luxurious model in the Mercedes-Benz lineup. The Maybach S-Class is powered by a 4.0-liter twin-turbocharged V8 engine that produces 496 horsepower and 516 lb-ft of torque. It is paired with a 9-speed automatic transmission and all-wheel drive. The Maybach S-Class gets an EPA-estimated 19 mpg in the city and 26 mpg on the highway. The Maybach S-Class has a longer wheelbase than the S-Class, which provides more legroom for rear passengers. The rear seats are separated by a console and have a number of features, including reclining seats, massage functions, and a refrigerator. The cargo space is 15.7 cubic feet. The Maybach S-Class comes standard with a number of features, including a 12.3-inch digital instrument cluster, a 12.3-inch touchscreen infotainment system, and a Burmester sound system. Available features include a panoramic sunroof, a head-up display, and a night-vision system.

Mercedes-Benz CLA Coupe

Starting at $39,350

The Mercedes-Benz CLA Coupe is a compact luxury coupe that was first introduced in 2013. It is the entry-level coupe in the Mercedes-Benz lineup. The CLA Coupe is available in two models: the CLA 250 and the CLA 45 AMG. The CLA 250 has a turbocharged 2.0-liter four-cylinder engine that produces 208 horsepower and 258 lb-ft of torque. The CLA 45 AMG has a turbocharged 2.0-liter four-cylinder engine that produces 382 horsepower and 354 lb-ft of torque.

Mercedes-Benz CLS Coupe

Starting at $76,500

The Mercedes-Benz CLS Coupe is a four-door coupe that was first introduced in 2004. It is a stylish and luxurious car that combines the elements of a sedan and a coupe. The CLS Coupe is available in two models: the CLS 450 and the AMG CLS 53. The CLS 450 has a turbocharged 3.0-liter inline-6 engine that produces 362 horsepower and 369 lb-ft of torque. The AMG CLS 53 has a turbocharged 3.0-liter inline-6 engine that produces 429 horsepower and 384 lb-ft of torque. The CLS Coupe has a spacious interior for its class and can seat up to five passengers. The cargo space is 11.9 cubic feet.

Mercedes-AMG GT 4-door Coupe

Starting at $95,900

The Mercedes-AMG GT 4-door Coupe is a high-performance sports sedan that was first introduced in 2018. It is based on the Mercedes-Benz CLS Coupe, but it has a more aggressive design and a more powerful engine. The AMG GT 4-door Coupe is available in three models: the GT 43, the GT 53, and the GT 63 S. The GT 43 has a turbocharged 3.0-liter inline-6 engine that produces 362 horsepower and 369 lb-ft of torque. The GT 53 has the same engine, but it is equipped with a mild-hybrid system that adds 21 horsepower and 184 lb-ft of torque. The GT 63 S has a twin-turbocharged 4.0-liter V8 engine that produces 630 horsepower and 664 lb-ft of torque.

Mercedes-Benz SL Roadster

Starting at $109,900

The new Mercedes-Benz SL Roadster is a two-door luxury convertible that was first introduced in 2022. It is the successor to the previous SL Roadster, which was discontinued in 2017. The new SL Roadster is available in two models: the SL 550 and the SL 63 AMG. The SL 550 has a turbocharged 4.0-liter V8 engine that produces 469 horsepower and 516 lb-ft of torque. The SL 63 AMG has the same engine, but it is equipped with a performance exhaust system and a more aggressive tune that produces 577 horsepower and 590 lb-ft of torque. Both models come standard with a 9-speed automatic transmission and rear-wheel drive. All-wheel drive is available as an option.

Sources: Manufacturers, ANDC, JATO Dynamics.
